metadata.title: CVE-2021-47054 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: bus:qcom: Put child node before return Put child node before return to fixpotential reference count leak. Generally, the reference count of child isincremented and decremented automatically in the macrofor_each_available_child_of_node() and should be decremented manually ifthe loop is broken in loop body.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2051-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2051.53
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2051-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2051.53
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2033-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2033.37
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2033-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2033.37
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2016-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2016.18
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2016-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2016.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.75').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2051.53').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2033.37').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2016.18').
